name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: [NOISE] This lecture is about the ordinal

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: logistic regression for sentiment analysis.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: _So
column6: this is our problem set up for a typical sentiment classification problem. _

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: Or more specifically a rating prediction.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: _We have an opinionated text document d as input
column6: and we want to generate as output

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: a rating in the range of 1 through k so

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: _it's a discrete rating
column6: and this is a categorization problem. _

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: We have k categories here.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: Now we could use a regular text for

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: categorization technique to solve this problem.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: But such a solution would not consider the order and dependency of the categories.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: _Intuitively
column6: the features that can distinguish category 2 from 1

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: _or rather rating 2 from 1
column6: may be similar to _

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: those that can distinguish k from k-1.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: _For example
column6: positive words generally suggest a higher rating. _

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: When we train categorization

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: problem by treating these categories as independent we would not capture this.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: So what's the solution?

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: Well in general we can order to classify and there are many different approaches.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: And here we're going to talk about one of them that

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: called ordinal logistic regression.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: _Now
column6: let's first think about how we use logistical regression for _

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: a binary sentiment.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: A categorization problem.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: So suppose we just wanted to distinguish a positive from a negative and

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: that is just a two category categorization problem.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: So the predictors are represented as X and these are the features.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: And there are M features all together.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: The feature value is a real number.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: And this can be representation of a text document.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: _And why it has two values
column6: binary response variable 0 or 1. _

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: _1 means X is positive
column6: 0 means X is negative. _

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: And then of course this is a standard two category categorization problem.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: We can apply logistical regression.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: _You may recall that in logistical regression
column6: we assume the log _

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: _of probability that the Y is equal to one
column6: is _

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: _assumed to be a linear function of these features
column6: as shown here. _

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: _So this would allow us to also write the probability of Y equals one
column6: given X _

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: in this equation that you are seeing on the bottom.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: So that's a logistical function and

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: _you can see it relates this probability to

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: probability that y=1 to the feature values.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: _And of course beta i's are parameters here
column6: so this is _

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: just a direct application of logistical regression for binary categorization.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: _What if we have multiple categories
column6: multiple levels? _

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: Well we have to use such a binary logistical regression problem

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: to solve this multi level rating prediction.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: And the idea is we can introduce multiple binary class files.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: _In each case we asked the class file to predict the

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: _whether the rating is j or above
column6: or the rating's lower than j. _

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: _So when Yj is equal to 1
column6: it means rating is j or above. _

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: _When it's 0
column6: that means the rating is Lower than j. _

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: _So basically if we want to predict a rating in the range of 1-k

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: we first have one classifier to distinguish a k versus others.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: And that's our classifier one.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: And then we're going to have another classifier to distinguish it.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: At k-1 from the rest.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: That's Classifier 2.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: _And in the end
column6: we need a Classifier to distinguish between 2 and 1. _

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: So altogether we'll have k-1 classifiers.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: Now if we do that of course then we can also solve this problem

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: and the logistical regression program will be also very straight forward

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: as you have just seen on the previous slide.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: Only that here we have more parameters.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: _Because for each classifier
column6: we need a different set of parameters. _

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: _So now the logistical regression classifies index by J

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: which corresponds to a rating level.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: And I have also used of J to replace beta 0.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: And this is to.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: _Make the notation more consistent

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: than was what we can show in the ordinal logistical regression.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: So here we now have basically k minus one regular logistic regression classifiers.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: Each has it's own set of parameters.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: _So now with this approach
column6: we can now do ratings as follows. _

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: _After we have trained these k-1 logistic regression classifiers

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: _separately of course
column6: then we can take a new instance and _

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: then invoke a classifier sequentially to make the decision.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: So first let look at the classifier that corresponds to level of rating K.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: So this classifier will tell us whether this object should

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: have a rating of K or about.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: If probability according to this logistical regression classifier is

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: _larger than point five
column6: we're going to say yes. _

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: The rating is K.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: _Now
column6: what if it's not as large as twenty-five? _

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: _Well
column6: that means the rating's below K

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: _So now
column6: we need to invoke the next classifier

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: which tells us whether it's above K minus one.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: It's at least K minus one.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: _And if the probability is larger than twenty-five

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: _then we'll say
column6: well

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: What if it says no?

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: _Well
column6: that means the rating would be even below k-1. _

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: And so we're going to just keep invoking these classifiers.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: And here we hit the end when we need to decide whether it's two or one.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: So this would help us solve the problem.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: Right?

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: So we can have a classifier that would actually give us a prediction of a rating

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: in the range of 1 through k.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: Now unfortunately such a strategy is not an optimal way of solving this problem.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: And specifically there are two problems with this approach.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: So these equations are the same as.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: You have seen before.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: Now the first problem is that there are just too many parameters.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: There are many parameters.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: _Now
column6: can you count how many parameters do we have exactly here? _

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: Now this may be a interesting exercise.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: To do. So

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: you might want to just pause the video and try to figure out the solution.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: How many parameters do I have for each classifier?

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: And how many classifiers do we have?

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: _Well you can see the
column6: and so it is that for each classifier we have _

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: _n plus one parameters
column6: and we have k minus one classifiers all together

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: so the total number of parameters is k minus one multiplied by n plus one.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: That's a lot.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: _A lot of parameters
column6: so when the classifier has a lot of parameters

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: _we would in general need a lot of data out to actually help us
column6: training data

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: to help us decide the optimal parameters of such a complex model.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: So that's not ideal.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: _Now the second problems is that these problems

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: _these k minus 1 plus fives
column6: are not really independent. _

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: These problems are actually dependent.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: _In general
column6: words that are positive would make the rating higher _

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: for any of these classifiers.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: For all these classifiers.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: So we should be able to take advantage of this fact.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: Now the idea of ordinal logistical regression is precisely that.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: The key idea is just the improvement over the k-1

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: independent logistical regression classifiers.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: And that idea is to tie these beta parameters.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: And that means we are going to assume the beta parameters.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: These are the parameters that indicated the inference of those weights.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: And we're going to assume these beta values are the same for

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: all the K- 1 parameters.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: _And this just encodes our intuition that

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: positive words in general would make a higher rating more likely.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: _So this is intuitively assumptions
column6: so reasonable for our problem setup. _

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: And we have this order in these categories.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: _Now in fact
column6: this would allow us to have two positive benefits. _

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: One is it's going to reduce the number of families significantly.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: And the other is to allow us to share the training data.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: Because all these parameters are similar to be equal.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: _So these training data
column6: for different classifiers can then be _

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: shared to help us set the optimal value for beta.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: So we have more data to help us choose a good beta value.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: _So what's the consequence

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: _well the formula would look very similar to what you have seen before only that

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: now the beta parameter has just one index that corresponds to the feature.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: It no longer has the other index that corresponds to the level of rating.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: So that means we tie them together.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: And there's only one set of better values for all the classifiers.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: _However
column6: each classifier still has the distinct R for value. _

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: The R for parameter.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: Except it's different.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: And this is of course needed to predict the different levels of ratings.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: _So R for sub j is different it depends on j
column6: different than j

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: has a different R value.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: _But the rest of the parameters
column6: the beta i's are the same. _

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: _So now you can also ask the question
column6: how many parameters do we have now? _

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: _Again
column6: that's an interesting question to think about. _

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: _So if you think about it for a moment
column6: and _

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: _you will see now
column6: the param

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: Specifically we have M plus K minus one.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: _Because we have M
column6: beta values
column7: and plus K minus one of our values. _

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: _So let's just look basically

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: that's basically the main idea of ordinal logistical regression.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: _So
column6: now
column7: let's see how we can use such a method to actually assign ratings. _

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: _It turns out that with this
column6: this idea of tying all the parameters

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: We also end up by having a similar way to make decisions.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: _And more specifically now
column6: the criteria whether the predictor probabilities _

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: _are at least 0.5 above
column6: and now is equivalent to _

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: whether the score of the object is larger than or

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: _equal to negative authors of j
column6: as shown here. _

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: _Now
column6: the scoring function is just taking the linear combination of _

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: all the features with the divided beta values.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: _So
column6: this means now we can simply make a decision of rating

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: _the value of this scoring function
column6: and see which bracket it falls into. _

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: _Now you can see the general decision rule is thus

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: _when the score is in the particular range of all of our values

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: then we will assign the corresponding rating to that text object.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: _So in this approach
column6: we're going to score the object _

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: by using the features and trained parameter values.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: This score will then be compared with a set of trained

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: alpha values to see which range the score is in.

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: _And then

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: _using the range
column6: we can then decide which rating the object should be getting. _

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: _Because
column6: these ranges of alpha values correspond to the different _

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: _levels of ratings
column6: and that's from the way we train these alpha values. _

name: 5 - 3 - 4.3 Opinion Mining and Sentiment Analysis- Ordinal Logistic Regression (00-13-43).srt
text: Each is tied to some level of rating.
